thread.title: Red Wings outplay Penguins, 5-2, for 2nd straight stunner
thread.title_full: Red Wings outplay Penguins, 5-2, for 2nd straight stunner

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Red Wings outplay Penguins, 5-2, for 2nd straight stunner
text: Red Wings outplay Penguins, 5-2, for 2nd straight stunner Hand the defending Stanley Cup champions only their fourth home regulation loss of the season? Check. Post to Facebook Red Wings outplay Penguins, 5-2, for 2nd straight stunner Hand the defending Stanley Cup champions only their fourth home regulation loss of the season? Check.  //on.freep.com/2lkxObv   Join the Conversation To   Red Wings outplay Penguins, 5-2, for 2nd straight stunner Helene St. James , Detroit Free Press Published 6:05 p.m.   5 minutes ago Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings defenseman Nick Jensen defends Penguins center Matt Cullen during the second period at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings coach Jeff Blashill gestures on the bench against the Penguins during the first period at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports The Penguins' Sidney Crosby and the Red Wings' Darren Helm fight for the puck in the second period in Pittsburgh, Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Gene J. Puskar, AP Xavier Ouellet of the Red Wings clears the puck against Evgeni Malkin of the Penguins at PPG PAINTS Arena on Feb. 19, 2017 in Pittsburgh. Matt Kincaid, Getty Images Pittsburgh Penguins' Phil Kessel can't get a shot past Detroit Red Wings goalie Petr Mrazek in the first period in Pittsburgh, Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Gene J. Puskar, AP Red Wings' Nick Jensen (3) celebrates his goal with Justin Abdelkader (8) and Andreas Athanasiou (72) in the first period in Pittsburgh, Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Gene J. Puskar, AP The Penguins' Sidney Crosby collides with the Red Wings' Niklas Kronwall in the first period in Pittsburgh, Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Gene J. Puskar, AP Red Wings' Nick Jensen gets the puck past Penguins goalie Matt Murray for a goal in the first period in Pittsburgh, Sunday, Feb. 19, 2017. Gene J. Puskar, AP Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings defenseman Nick Jensen, left, celebrates his goal with right wing Anthony Mantha against the Penguins during the first period at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Penguins center Sidney Crosby skates with the puck between Red Wings center Dylan Larkin (71) and defenseman Ryan Sproul during the first period at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings goalie Petr Mrazek makes a save against Penguins right wing Patric Hornqvist as Red Wings defenseman Danny DeKeyser defends during the first period at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Penguins owner Mario Lemieux (left) presents center Sidney Crosby with a comparative plaque in honor of Crosby's 1000th career NHL point before the game against the Red Wings at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings defenseman Ryan Sproul takes the ice against the Penguins at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings goalie Petr Mrazek takes shots during warm-ups before playing the Penguins at the PPG PAINTS Arena. Charles LeClaire, USA TODAY Sports Feb 19, 2017; Pittsburgh, PA, USA; Red Wings center Dylan Larkin skates on the ice before playing the Penguins at the PPG PAINTS Arena.
